alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 2:10AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southern California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 415 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 210 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, Oceanside, Carlsbad, El Cajon, Vista, Encinitas, National City, La Mesa, Poway, Imperial Beach, Ramona, Coronado, Del Mar, Tierrasanta, University City, La Jolla, Linda Vista, Mission Valley, North Park and Hillcrest. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
